website_summaries.verdict: For the weekend do-it-yourselfer, this orbit sander tackles any small project handily, but dust collection can be an annoyance.
pros: Good power at its price point
Ergonomic design fits smaller hands, and novices find this sander easy to control
cons: A bit louder than similar sanders
Sanding pads can fly off if tool is not firmly placed on surface to be sanded
Dust collector does not always work well
A few reports of tool failing after several months

customer_reviews.title: Easy - works great - it's all you need if your not a pro
customer_reviews.text: Never used a sander before - literally took it out of the box and did not read any instructions. Super simple and self explanatory to use. I know nothing about grades of sand paper? I got the variety pack Amazon recommend with purchase and stick the 60 on there... within a couple hours I had a really old/ugly cabinet that had a shiny coat of varnish on it, sanded down to the bare wood with no problem at all. It's like - step 1. Plug sander in 2. Stick sandpaper on 3. Hit the on button. I can't see this sander having issues completing any normal projects at all.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good homeowner sander
customer_reviews.text: Good sander for good price. Great for the homeowner. Item is listed at having 5 amp capacity yet is only a 2 amp sander. Not a hinderence to use, but a misrepresentation.
customer_reviews.author: Frequentshopper

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this sander a ZERO I would. First time used as I just got it, and the sander just barely turns, and that's when it's not pressed against wood. When it's pressed against wood it nearly stops turning entirely. I spent 20 minutes trying to sand a very small piece of wood and the paint is still on the wood. I used 80 grit sandpaper on it which is more than enough to sand the paint off, but not with this awful sander. It's a big waste of money. Spend a few bucks extra and get one that's worth it. This one can't do a simple sanding job.
customer_reviews.author: SummyG

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and low priced
customer_reviews.text: After a year or so this sander just burnt up on me. I am a hobby woodworker and put this thing through quite a bit of use (and probably abuse) so for the price I would say the lifespan of this tool was very reasonable. I tend to be pretty hard on palm sanders so I would say under normal use this one would last years in the right hands. Biggest deterrent for this sander is the dust collection port/filter wasnt very reliable or sturdy. After emptying it just a handful of times the seal never sat right again. Aside from that i would say dollar for dollar this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worked intermittent out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Bought for one medium size, not too intense project. The thing cut on and off intermittently during use. Thought it would be switch based on other reviews. Seemed to be the power cable end, it would work if I jiggled the plug in the outlet just right. I wouldn't recommend based on the cheap unreliable electrical problems. I'd fix a tool and year or two old, but not one that has so many problems straight out of the box. Home depot ryobi ones are even worse, I've tried 3, and each one failed within the first hour or two of service. Bad luck I guess, but really just cheap junk from China. I'll go dewalt
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it do to concave pad.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because the hook and loop pad was noticeably concave. When I was sanding contact was only really being made with the edges leaving the center of the sanding pads clean. I later bought a Ryobi which did work better, but I noticed that it too has a slight inward curvature but the insides od the sanding pads do engage the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Anything but my real name

customer_reviews.title: You will get wood dust EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: I used 120 and 180 grit pad with this to sand stairs in my house. It works okay however, I DO NOT recommend this because it took me more time cleaning up the wood dust that went everywhere all over the floor, the walls, the sander machine, and on me than to sand the steps. The catcher doesn’t work as advertised, it serves no purpose. I’m keeping the machine because it might come in handy for mini outside DIY projects. I could not believe just after 3 minutes dust was all over the orbit sander. See pictures
customer_reviews.author: MOM OF  3Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: it didnt sand well. it was very uneven and ...
customer_reviews.text: it didnt sand well. it was very uneven and left weird little circular squiggles. I would go with a square sander for sure
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Stout

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Well, you get what you paid for. Bought this in November and the motor burned out after using it for 3 months. I only used it for a couple hours a day 1-2 days out of the week. The last time I used it, the sander slowed down and turned off every time I put any pressure on it and then I noticed it getting really hot in my hand. That's when I looked inside and saw a bright blue light and I started smelling some kind of electrical burn. Also, the vibration is pretty intense. My arm would start hurting after a while. Time to just upgrade to a better sander.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT sander, GREAT price, Lasts a LONG TIME.
customer_reviews.text: I used the HELL out of my first B&D orbital sander and after 6 years it finally died. Amazon Prime delivered it to me the SAME DAY even though it was supposed to be 2-day delivery! I'm glad the basic design hasn't changed though the dust collection bag has been improved. Yes, the 5" sanding discs are pricey compared to the consumables for rectangular paper sanders but it makes changing SOOOO much easier and faster. The discs last forever, too. I expect this sander to provide the same excellent performance it's predecessor did and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Buy American

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, Efficient and Inexpensive. I am using This to sand my F150 and it has made quick work in a short amount of time. Only Negative is the vaccuum bag is not that effective and if you wear the edges of a pads down to much you may eat away at the Velcro if you aren't paying to much attention to it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Do no buy. Broke within a week and uncomfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, do not buy. Was excited that I found such a cheap tool, but nope you get what you paid for. I barely used this for a week and now the disk pad Velcro does not stick any sandpaper anymore. The cheaply made little hooks on the Velcro are all disfigured from less than 10 usage. Plus the tool is so clumsy and holding it for less than 10 min give me palm cramps... just spend the extra dollars and get a decent orbit sander from other big brands. This is such a waste of money and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Yi

customer_reviews.title: decent sander
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 'hands off' sander as I am doing a project which requires over 2,000 pieces of small wood. Although this unit is NOT a hands-off sander I simply placed it in my small vice and off I went. For the price you can't beat it. Highly recommended. Only complaint is its a bit loud in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES KERRY

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good for the price. I needed this in a hurry and did not expect the best quality from B&D, but I was pleasantly surprised. Not the same quality as some of the higher end brands, but still good in a pinch. I would buy this again. Pros: works as expected, fits most brands of orbital sand paper, still gives a good smooth surface, despite not being a true random orbital. Cons: the dust collection is very poor, and it is not as random as some higher end brands, it basically just spins. Have not taken it apart, but I would bet that it is not on a offset bearing.
customer_reviews.author: C n C Computers

customer_reviews.title: Same problem with defective power button others are having
customer_reviews.text: On/off button doesn't work. I already tossed the box before I found out this is a defect and not something I'm doing wrong. I don't sand much. I'll get something better if I need to do any more projects. I can get it to keep running if I push the button several times and hold it down a while. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This sander rocks
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this during a bathroom reno and it's awesome. Very simple to use and it's very light. I was a bit disappointed that I cannot find Black & Decker 5" sanding pads. I have to use an odd brand I found in LOWES. The circles don't match up exactly, but it works fine. I even GOOGLED trying to find them to order online, but they do not exist. Anyhow, I love this sander, the bathroom is finished and now I am sanding a storage chest so I can stain it. Branching out, facing my power-tool fear is working out wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Pad sheared off within first two hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers here and at Lowes site have found out, the hook and loop pad simply is junk...shears off for no reason. Had high hopes as this sander did a great job initially then it began acting weird and "pop" off came the pad. Yes, you can buy a replacement for about 12.00 and after three years of use that might be OK, but not less than 2 hours. NOT a good tool. I remember when Black and Decker was about the ONLY tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions, but the discs fly off, the "hook and loop" system rarely works. A waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Searchname

customer_reviews.title: Was a good deal, (when priced at $15)
customer_reviews.text: Two years of rather occasional use and dead. Sure it worked good while it lasted and I got it for a crazy deal so it was definitely worth it for me. The defect in mine was the rear motor "guide", (bottom left in picture), it should have been an actual bearing. It got wobbly as the plastic housing wore and seized the motor. But this thing just has so much power the electromagnets kept moving without the axle, ripping up the epoxy and severing the copper wires of the motor. Would love to hear they upgraded guide for a bearing, then this upgraded price might be worth another try.
customer_reviews.author: SkagitBeetFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a week
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, I know, it's cheap. It's 1/3 of the price comparing to other brands. For a DIYer like me, I thought life from three units must be longer than one, right? Well, the first one lasted 4 moderate use in a week and started to make high pitch weird noise.....I used other brand sander before and never had this issue....Maybe I got a lemon and I am able to return it through Amazon as it's only two weeks away from my purchase date. I'd recommend other buyers to buy it right before your project so that at least you would have option to return it if it goes out quickly....
customer_reviews.author: Zheng Tianxi

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: The review asked if it was easy to maneuver, yes. Decent ergonomics, yes. Easy to hold, also yes. It only lasted 3 minutes. And that whole 3 minutes it would start up, slow down, and then stop. Then I’d lift it, shake it and it would start again. Then... it just quit all together. JUNK. UPDATE: exchanged the junk sander for a new one. New one works just fine. The power button isn’t very clicky. I could definitely see the switch going out. But for the price it’s doing just fine. I can recommend it if you have a few small projects or don’t plan to use it often. If you’re looking for something for heavy use, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C Leonard III

customer_reviews.title: 1 year later, over 100 sanding pads used and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, I've been rebuilding my house from the studs out for 18 months now...GRRRR... I got this sander over a year ago for various projects during the build - and I'm still using it literally today! Currently making a fireplace mantle with leftover wood. I originally got a 100 pack of various grit papers, went thru that, now I'm on a 60 pack I bought. This guy still hasn't let me down! I shake out the dust bag every use, and I've had to clean paint/caulk off of it from time to time (cuz I'm a neat freak), but still doing its job! YOU CANNOT BEAT THIS VALUE AT THIS PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. I use industrial sanders for work but for at home use this is not bad. I used it before resurfacing a coffee table and it gets the job done. There is a white ring when you take off the pad that deteriorates quickly but serves little purpose other than providing a buffer between the sander and the pad. Removed it and no other issues. I do recommend the additional hook and loop pad for when one breaks down. Overall not bad and I am happy with my purchase. I will likely upgrade to another quality when this one is done for.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie and Stephen Russell

customer_reviews.title: Switch ON-OFF failed intermittently. Stay away from this sander.
customer_reviews.text: After the second time use, the on-off switch failed intermittently. I could not turn it on unless put the pressure and hold down the switch to keep the motor running. Bad quality product, I rather spent little extra money to get the better quality sander. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for such a cheap price, I read the reviews and saw the people who cried it didn't catch all the dust lol. It catches more dust then most the high priced ones at a tenth the price,helps to line up the holes on the sanding disk pads too. wish u could adjust the speed and the power button sometimes hard to get to stay in the on position when u first start it, but for the price this is a GREAT tool
customer_reviews.author: A mad customer

customer_reviews.title: Danger! My caught fire! Only had it for 7 months! Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This style of sander is one of the best you can get. I bought this sander 7 months ago. I haven’t used it a ton but worked really well for the most part. Unfortunately it just caught fire while I was using it. I was sanding as usual then it started loosing power then I noticed it was smoking. Started humming loudly then flashed with sparks. I unplugged it and used the cord to get it safely outside. I highly recommend you spend just alittle bit more money to get a better quality random orbit Sander.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Works for my basic needs
customer_reviews.text: Obviously there are better sanders out there for pros/serious hobbyists but for my occasional needs around the house this works for me. Used on outdoor table/benches prior to re-applying stain/sealant and a few minutes of sanding the trouble spots made a big difference in quality of results. Five stars easy at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Great pick!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this palm sander! It was a great price and I have been putting in alot of hours of use. It takes the use like a champ. Easy to use Great price Works great
customer_reviews.author: DeterminedDIY

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more? This one works great.
customer_reviews.text: For ;an inexpensive sander, this Black & Decker does a great job. I've used it several times with zero problems. It does manage to send most of the sawdust waste into the holder on the handle and changing sanding disks is effortless. I use this for projects around the house like touch-ups on deck boards and railings. Before making this purchase, I had my doubts, because of the low price, but now that I've used it several times, I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one when this one gives up the ghost. Very little vibration and the noise isn't bad. I wear ear protection when I use it, so noise has not been an issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: SLS-LDS

customer_reviews.title: Spews dust everywhere!!!!!! Won't take off paint.
customer_reviews.text: My BF ordered this to remove paint from our pergola. I put the dust bag on and used it for about 20-30 minutes. I got almost no paint off of the pergola and I was covered in dust... along with the ladder and the ground and all of the trees around me. You could see the dust in flying in the air. About the only thing that came of of this was the paint stripper, which would have come off with a water hose or a towel. We will be returning this! Such a waste of money and time!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M. Reed

customer_reviews.title: disk is not flat!
customer_reviews.text: The disk (platen) is not flat. Can ruin project and sandpaper.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: decor bad does not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these now, they usually last 3 to 6 months then the deco on the sanding pad doesn't hold the sand paper very well, ordered different pads but Black & Decker doesn't seem to stock them and the new bads that says it should fit the sander never fit, great sander they all still work just won't hold sand paper, tried the extended warranty but found out it does not included pad. sure would like to find pad that works, as of now no luck.
customer_reviews.author: denny

customer_reviews.title: Burned out and pieces flew out in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to properly sand an entertainment center I built. Towards the end of the project, I turned it on to sand and it started squealing and wouldn’t move when it had touched the work piece. I turned it off, unplugged it and.l checked it out. Nothing was stuck, no issues. Turned it back on and a piece flew out of the middle and cut my hand and face. Don’t waste your money on a cheapie sander. Upgrade to something $20-40 more expensive and it will last a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Felton

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: This tool seems powerful, it is very loud and I am not sure it is good for heavy duty work. I tried to get rid of circular saw marks on a piece of wood using 40, 80, 120 and 240 grits with this tool and it did not completely smoothed it out. I read all instructions, etc. and have used orbital sander years ago, but it did not do what I needed. Will research it more and see if I am not using it right way. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: Taty Z Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality in the design.
customer_reviews.text: The face tore and fell off while using this one for the first time. This is the 2nd of these sanders I have purchased. The first one started making a really loud screeching noise from the motor. Very disappointed with the quality of this product! Paid more money for this one than one I purchased at lowes which is another model sander by black and decker also that one I haven't had any problems with by my employee likes the design of this one with the switch button as mine is another design. Please fix this issue!
customer_reviews.author: Travis thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Weekender sander
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this sander because it did not come in time. I bought the same exact sander locally. This is a great small handheld sander. The size of this sander fits right in the palm of your hand nicely, it is not overly loud. My husband likes woodworking on the weekends as a hobby. This works well for what he does. The dust collector does collect some of the dust. The sander pads are easily replaced when worn.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda lg

customer_reviews.title: Works fast with little effort
customer_reviews.text: Works well in removing paint with little effort. Just as the instructions state you do not need to use pressure while sanding. Like the velcro type pad for disc attachments
customer_reviews.author: Hope2help

customer_reviews.title: Invest in something different
customer_reviews.text: If you are needing a sander for a small project, or never to be used again this could work great for you. I read several great reviews so I purchased this and really wish I had invested in something different. I am sanding a dresser down to finish it in the bare wood tone and it is taking me forever with this thing. Half the time the sanding disk isn’t spinning, just shaking, because this thing has no power to it. To really do this project I would have preferred more power and a sander with a handle on it for easier holding / steering.
customer_reviews.author: Jsmoot

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a long time since I have been impressed with anything Black and Decker makes but that recently changed. I had to strip a hood and my air driven sander broke. I remembered this little sander I had sitting on the shelf. I was skeptical however I grabbed some disks and started in. Hours later I completed the task, I didn’t get hot, slow down or miss a lick during that whole ordeal! I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Rusted Nut Garage

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by how well this works
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was expecting, but for this price I was thinking it was not going to be so efficient. I haven't used it a ton, I'm not a serious wood worker. I'm kind of getting into the hobby and was working on a couple of projects that I wanted to sand but didn't really care how good they looked. I figured it the low cost would be worth the time savings, and it easily was. Quickly and effortlessly rounded off a bunch of sharp edges and corners and smoothed some table tops. I have pretty big hands and it was comfortable in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Atom Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: A great sander, period.
customer_reviews.text: I'd retired from 40 years of building furniture, but needed to build one last piece & no longer had my obligatory random orbital sander. It was cheap &, after using it heavily for the last few weeks, has functioned as well as any of the "respectable" brands I used in years gone by. I didn't expect that.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Mccollum

customer_reviews.title: Worked only a few times
customer_reviews.text: I used this sander once a week for about three weeks, and it worked well until today, when it suddenly started slowing way down when pressed against anything (as in, when actually sanding something). It goes normal speed when not sanding, but becomes almost useless when sanding. I wouldn't say it was worth it; if I wanted a sander that lasted only a few days, I would have just borrowed someone else's. I'd return it, but I'm about a month outside the refund window.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Orbital Sander
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this sander!! It was the best purchase of all my tools! It makes sanding anything much faster than hand sanding. I find the replacement circles of sandpaper cheaper on amazon than at my local hardware store, but I didn't check prices at the local big-box places. I highly recommend this sander for those small projects. I used it to sand the varnish off of my two back doors and then I repainted them. I do recommend you wear a dust mask and protective eye googles as it does kick up a bit of dust and you don't want to breathe that in or get those particles in your eyes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Helper

customer_reviews.title: Really Good for a One-Speed Sander
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sander, especially for wood projects and wooden floors. I have used it on both and the results were fantastic. There are 2 cons with this product and one is the bag for the dust. It does not do much good and fills up very fast... be prepared to empty it out quite frequently. The other con is that there is no speed-selection. It has one speed and it is a good speed for most projects, but you may want a slower speed for more smaller projects. Overall, this is great for the price and will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Technosapien

customer_reviews.title: On/Off Button Has Design Flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive orbital sander worth the money. The only thing I can say after constant use over the years is that the On/Off button becomes a pain to manage after a while. You'll press the On button but it doesn't click, so it turns on but doesn't stay on. I really need to use my fingernail to press in the On button. This is probably due to the rubber that protects the switch from dust. I'm not mad at this purchase as one it's powered on and it stays, it works like a dream. Just be weary of this one issue.
customer_reviews.author: Eddi

customer_reviews.title: ON/OFF SWITCH FAILED just after 90 day return window
customer_reviews.text: The power toggle switch crapped out after maybe 10 uses of 5 minutes each. I was leery about the design of the switch when I first used it. I should have followed my intuition and sent it back then. I have only had it for about 100 days, so can't do a free return. Probably not worth my time or money trying to get factory service from manufacturer based on other reviews. I will be buying another brand. Thanks Mr. Black and Mr. Decker!
customer_reviews.author: Myron Checketts

customer_reviews.title: Quality and durable and works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted and held up very well, its helped teach my kids how to sand and use something powered. For an adult size and ergonomics are great, for kids depending on the child it could or couldnt work. Very durable it's taken many falls from tables and chairs ect, it hasnt cracked or broken skipped a beat through out the damage it's been given
customer_reviews.author: Mike Thornton

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tool, regardless of price point!
customer_reviews.text: This sander is brilliant! It functions quietly, stores the sawdust it creates in the atachable pouch it comes with, (which doesn't get in the way in the least) and has cut my sanding time to a fraction of the time, with accuracy and consistency. No regrets, I can easily reccomend this tool and would repurchase without a second thought. Ps. I've also compared this to the DeWalt and this is simply eaqually as good if not better and definitely better at collecting saw dust.
customer_reviews.author: Ubersocrates

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but passable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just an OK sander. I bought this to replace an older B&D random orbital sander-- the old one lasted quite well, but the bearings finally failed. This new sander is just not the same quality. I've used random orbital sanders built by at least three different companies, including my older B&D pro model. This one feels like the shaft might be slightly out of alignment. When placed on a surface for sanding, the head of the sander wobbles just a little bit. I guess it's possible that it is due to a different design to achieve the "randomness", but to me, it just feels wrong.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a solid budget sander
customer_reviews.text: In addition to other uses, this sander was used 3 times to sand the bottom paint of a sailboat, which creates a huge amount of dust. While it does not catch all the dust by any means, it catches a lot of it and it makes the sanding job a lot easier than doing it by hand. After 3 years (and no extended warranty), this sander suddenly quit working so we bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Made the right choice
customer_reviews.text: I am a "weekend" project guy, thus not looking for a contractor grade product (nor the price!). I read all of the reviews and took a flyer on this sander. I couldn't be happier. I spent several years working in a cabinet shop and woodworking during high school and college. This sander works as well as any "industrial" tool I have used. I also purchased the box with extra sanding pads. Happy with both purchased and great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TS in MN

customer_reviews.title: Works well but Makes a Mess
customer_reviews.text: This sander sands well but it does a poor job of collecting the sanding dust and kicks it out all over the place even when the bag is emptied often. The bag seems to be porous and the outside of it is quickly covered in sanding dust. I'm using it on kitchen cabinets that are in place and I ate a lot of dust so be aware that a face mask is needed if sanding indoors.
customer_reviews.author: JanW

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a durable and reliable tool!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up in a family of carpenters and worked with tools for many years. My career took me down a different path and into the world of clinical research studies. Recently I decided to purchase some tools to be able to work on some DIY projects. This was one of my first purchases and I love it. It's easy to hold and maneuver. Grips the sandpaper tight and is extremely durable. This is an excellent tool and is up to par with its competition that are double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rock CTR

customer_reviews.title: This little guy made refinishing my porch a breeze. Went right down to bare wood and it didn't miss a beat. At half the price o
customer_reviews.text: This little guy made refinishing my porch a breeze. Went right down to bare wood and it didn't miss a beat. At half the price of other brands/models, you can't go wrong. The dust bag does work (some people here complained about it) but don't expect to sand inside your house with your grandmother's fancy quilts laid out on the table. That wont happen with any sander. But I did notice that there was less dust in my face outside when the bag wasn't full so it does something. Overall, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: coolmen

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this sander for just over a month and it's already malfunctioning. The sander seems to be adding more power as if it's compensating for something which is causing it to just burn everything it touches. I have to go through and hand sand everything to remove the burn marks. I want to point out, I know how to sand. This was not an issue for the first 3 weeks of use. I also regularly clean the sander with a shop vac to make sure dust doesn't build up. Very disappointed. I will have to run to Home Depot now to buy a different sander.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: For the woodworker or diy home improvement enthusiast on a budget this sander is perfect. I wouldn't rave about its capabilities but it gets the job done just fine. Dust filter works but beware; the dust that escapes because it is too fine for the filter is what poses the greatest hazard to your health. Best to use this outdoors, in a well ventilated shop, or directly attached to dust collection with an extremely fine filter. I gave my filter a small upgrade by wrapping it in a nylon stocking so it was capturing just a bit more dust and letting less into the air when not hooked up to my dust collector.
customer_reviews.author: ThirdEyePriedWide

customer_reviews.title: Love this little work horse!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this sander! I needed something to sand down disgusting, grungy cabinets because I didn't have the energy to wash the grunge off and this sander is a life saver! Light weight, the bag caught a lot of the dust, even though I was working outside. This little work horse will get a lot of use!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A Slack

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Heavy to hold for long periods, and you have to remove the filter to empty pretty often which is a pain. Also there’s, no easy way to get the dust out. I had to use a pencil to get it out which still didn’t prove to make it that much easier. Overall, I’m happy with the purchase and would recommend it. Great for sanding wallpaper trim which is why I purchased it, initially, but will be used for many other projects, too!
customer_reviews.author: HappyLady

customer_reviews.title: Best $24.00 I have EVER SPENT!!  This sander is completely AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first sander I have ever bought -- and I did a lot of research and felt that this would be the best buy for my buck....and boy was that right! I am SUPER impressed with this sander. So far, I have used it to completely strip 4 layers of paint off of 2 steel exterior doors as well as sanding some areas of dry-wall that we had patched. It ran pretty much ALL DAY LONG without a single glitch. Did not overheat, never quit on me. I cannot say enough good things about this sander!! BUY IT -- you will not regret spending $24.00 on this great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Herald

customer_reviews.title: Great for finishing
customer_reviews.text: I can't do nice wood working without this machine, especially if you build from scratch and the lumber you start out with is in less than perfect condition. It's hard to knock of stock with his machine thought - it takes a long time. I would recommend more for finish sanding. This machine is loud, it has a nice dust collector, but it's a good price and it works. Hasn't had any reliability issues at all. I bought 120 and 220 grits and plan on using it repeatedly for DIY woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this for a few hours sanding about a 4'x4' piece of plywood. Everything works well and it is simple to use. The vacuum bag works really well for me and traps most of the particles. Not a lot of dust kicked out into the air at all. I found some cheap 5 inch sandpaper discs on here and they fit perfectly. Here is what I bought
customer_reviews.author: Terassic

customer_reviews.title: ... are not enough ways to say how much I love this little sander
customer_reviews.text: There are not enough ways to say how much I love this little sander. I use it a lot. I enjoy sitting down and sanding with it. Yes it will still produce a lot of dust, I'm still emptying the dust collector though so in general I'm producing a lot dust. I happen to enjoy the smell of sawdust though so no complaints about sawdust. It works exactly as anticipated and was a great buy for the value. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Only thing worse then the noise is the quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Has very bad vibration( more noise) and mediocre at best dust collection. I tried to accommodate this by replacing the pad. The simple removal and reinserting of the screws (to the same depth) stripped the plastic to an extent the pad fell off. This was all on the 2nd project I had used it on.
customer_reviews.author: kagan boyle

customer_reviews.title: Need Some Elbow Grease
customer_reviews.text: I had a DIY project to repaint an old desk and needed a sander so I purchased this handy little guy. First, I need to mention that while I am a strong, independent woman (LOL) I am also lacking in the arm muscle area. While I'm sure that this product works well for most, I struggled a bit to get the results I wanted due to the amount of pressure I had to apply to the machine. It may have been user error or extra thick paint on my desk, but it took forever to sand down. It did the job eventually and it was pretty inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Erin F

customer_reviews.title: Great little sander
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind this is a small hand held sander! I am a small female. With that said the package was in tact, arrived a few days ago. Making a wall bed. This thing has exceeded my expectations. Does a great job and I can do it with one hand. For small jobs perfecto!
customer_reviews.author: Rockie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a year, then no more.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for nearly a year, then it broke. It revs far too high then when in contact with the surface I intend to sand, it is nearly impossible to avoid creating deep gashes in the wood before it then slows down far too much to be of any use. I doubt that I will even claim the warranty on it since sending it back and forth to the nearest service center would cost about the same as purchasing a brand new one. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BWH

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked good enough for a while, now it spins insanely fast like it wants to fly away. Can’t use it, it gouges the wood fast and goes out of control.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super super easy to use machine and sands down anything in a couple of minutes, recently had to sand down stairs in the basement and got tired of doing it by hand so decided to grab it and man it makes a huge difference in the final appearance and it shrinks the time needed ten fold! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great at sanding, extremely poor at dust collection
customer_reviews.text: This sander works well, but the dust collection is abysmal. You WILL have dust shooting out the sides of the sander, and to add insult to injury, the dust outlet port is oddly shaped so there's no way to hook up a vac to it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvan

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and does the job. The biggest pro is the price. This is not everyday use quality necessarily, but will get most jobs done, such as refinishing old furniture and the like. The only con is that the built-in dust collector does not work super well, although that is more likely a product of the hole pattern and ability for the device to pull the dust through it than the collector itself. Perhaps hooking a shop vac to the outlet port would remedy this con, but my shop vac nozzle was too large to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Spend Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this. I have only been using this sander since April and it’s already broken. Today I just turned it on only to have it start to make this horrible screeching noise and smell like burning rubber. Of course the return window has already closed and now I’m stuck having to buy something new. Not worth going with Black and Decker just spend a little extra to buy a better product. I’m so frustrated since I’m in the middle of a project and now have to spend money on a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent! I’ll preface that I’m a newbie woodworker, so I don’t know all of the details. However, I sanded an entire board with no issues. Very smooth operation and gliding. Also, little to no sand on the table, so the small suction holes underneath did their job! It’s working great so far and feels solid and sturdy. Can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain for the price !
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it! It handles well and is very maneuverable, but most of all, it holds the sanding disc in place until it’s well past being more out. Black & Decker has seened to have stepped up his game in both quality and construction engineering. I have both Dewalt and Makita random orbital sanders and the black and decker does the job just as well. Both my other Sanders I’ve had for over 10 years and I don’t know how well the B&D will stand up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Incarnato

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought something like this a long time ago. I pictured this thing spinning really fast but it instead rapidly oscillates while rotating slightly. So far I have only used it to grind down the bottle of a 5 gallon bucket to a smooth surface, for which it worked like a charm. For the price I recommend any person into crafts or refinishing pick this up. It makes me want to buy an old piece of furniture just so I can sand it down and refinish it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I used this to do various projects in the house from cabinets to tables with pervious stains or paints. It made the work much faster and easier. It sands evenly throughout the item. Although it doesn't get the corners of course because it is round. I was researching between this and a squared one, but so far a lot more people said the rounded gives you more of an even finish...I wish I got the square personally, but this did a great job. The dust didn't fly everywhere so much because it vacuums most of it into the bag. Its not too loud either. It has a Velcro so you just slap on the sand paper and go.
customer_reviews.author: AOK

customer_reviews.title: Great sander
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is one great tool. I've used this sander the last 3 years and I doubt a more expensive one could do any better. Dust can be a problem so I wear a mask or go outside when possible. Not everything tool Black and Decker tool I've used is worthy of a good review but here's an exception.
customer_reviews.author: phillip wood

customer_reviews.title: Good Sander for Medium Work
customer_reviews.text: I have a belt sander for shaping wood. I have a palm sander for the finish work. This one is a great in-between sander. I does a great job of taking off paint for refinishing. It will shape the wood a bit, if you stay on one spot too long. It's a bit strong for finish work. If you're looking for an all-around sander, this would be a good compromise in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hood

customer_reviews.title: Dust goes everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Decent little sander. I purchased this to help with some home improvements. I have been sanding rough spackle and the dust goes EVERYWHERE! Definitely make sure you have a mask and protective eyewear.
customer_reviews.author: Domokim2468

customer_reviews.title: Good orbital sander for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good sander for the price. Did the job that I needed it for. My only complaint and reason for 3 stars is that the dust bag that came with it had a hole in it. I’m going to contact Black and Decker to see about getting it replaced. Depending on their customer service, I’ll be back to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wendling

customer_reviews.title: Burned up after 12 months...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this sander, and used it about once a month for small projects, but it just burned up and starting sparking on me today. I bought it 1 year and 1 month ago. It’s sparking inside, stops spinning when I put it against material, and spins out of control when I take it off material.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely cheep but holds up well. Plastic seams cheep which is why I gave 4 stars but it just works and works. My son is in construction and has had same one for 4 years , it just keeps going.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D Mccombs

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: I like this sander, but my one gripe is I wish there was a lower setting. It feels like it takes off out of your hands at its default mode.
customer_reviews.author: Rynn

customer_reviews.title: B & D Random Orbit Sander
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent. Love that it has a bag to collect sanded dust, it is noisy but my goodness it really does hte job very nicely and quickly. Love this little sander. so much nicer than the flat sander which I had had....and, gave away years ago....Although it was also a B & D..... Thank you. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: spirits&angels

customer_reviews.title: Good for small projects
customer_reviews.text: Wish this was slightly more powerful. I used this sander to completely sand down an old 7-foot dining table. Needless to say it took me about a full day to get the table fully sanded and ready for stain. It got the job done though! Slow and steady wins the race? I would not recommend using this for big projects.
customer_reviews.author: onefastricerocket

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to sand down 1 bath/shower, 8 doors and 1 wooden workshop bench for refinishing. This sander is inexpensive and a total life saver and hasnt failed me yet after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.author: michaelmiller77

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived as advertised. I have only used it briefly on a sample to be sure it is operational, and it seems to work as it should. When a project comes along - if there is anything to detract from the 5 stars, I'll report back. Meanwhile, I'm relying on Black & Decker's reputation.
customer_reviews.author: dscotrobin

customer_reviews.title: Poor power!
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight so is not like a toy as the price might suggest. However, I tried sanding down the side of a particle board and the sander kept losing rotation speed! I used a light touch but it was as if I had put too much pressure. Wast of money. Like reviews have noted, the dust bag is pretty much useless so use it outdoors to avoid getting any inside your home.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought to do car body work. Good value for the money. The hook and loop is very strong. My only complaint is that the pad will stop spinning at times if the sander isn't flat on the sanding surface and any extra pressure. I've used a variety of sanders over the years in my wood shop. This will be a good addition for flat surface applications.
customer_reviews.author: Dmoose

customer_reviews.title: Dust everywhere, project sanded.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the dust colelctor is really just for show, as it appears to not have the suction to get anything into it. After tons of use there's barely anything in it. But other than that, it does the job quite well. I'm sure there are fancier ones with more than one speed, and that don't leave as much dust about, but it does the job quite well and is grippable and ergonomic. It's a tool that's functional. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lorestream

customer_reviews.title: Great sander for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking a this and the DeWalt version. This one is about 20 bucks cheaper. My brother has the DeWalt so we did a side by side test and other that the DeWalt being a touch more quiet, it's not a 20 dollars worth difference. I have about 12 hours of use out of it so it's still very new, but I have zero complaints. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: CJ S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This sander might be cheap but let me tell you it works like a horse. It's wonderful I had some old very weathered pallet wood that I sanded down for a reallyyyy long time and it just kept on trucking! Also some people mentioned it didnt do a good job catching the sawdust lol that's a lie I only had about a tablespoon or 2 of sawdust at my area when I finished most of it was sucked right up into the little baggy
customer_reviews.author: Glive

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty Sander
customer_reviews.text: This sander works good... but after hours of use, it quit working. I took it apart to simply find that some of the pieces/bushings were plastic and had simply worn out from the vibrations. Worked great until it wore out.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use around my horse trailer and pickup and so far so good. The sander uses hook and loop sandpaper pads (Velcro) so it's easy to change out and the pads don't go anywhere. This sander does have a little dust collector on it, which is nice. Super easy to use (just turn it on and off) and it's working great.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous P

customer_reviews.title: "High performance dust collection" is a sham
customer_reviews.text: The sander works well but the dust collection system may as well be nonexistent because it does a terrible job. This was a gift and I will continue to use it for light jobs, but I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Broke after light usage....
customer_reviews.text: This thing "was" great for the first few times I used it but something gave inside it during light use (while sanding pine for wooden flags) and it just wouldn't work right afterwards. You get what you pay for. Thus this is why I've moved on to a better brand that cost a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but it's works good
customer_reviews.text: For the price is nice to have as I only bought it to sand a golf cart body and prep for paint but found myself using it to sand tires for my go kart as well and seems to work very well at both and it decently comfortable to use
customer_reviews.author: Joshua N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, was a little sad I hadn't paid attention to the fact that it only came with 1 sandpaper & only1 speed. I trust Black and Decker though. I did a lot of research, saw a couple others I kind of wish I had gotten instead.
customer_reviews.author: C. Haddenham

customer_reviews.title: It’s melting
customer_reviews.text: This sucker heats up fast! And The putty/glue that holds the face of the sander to the main part started melting and falling off! Yikes. Really a shame because it’s easy to use, but don’t really want to get to the point where the face falls off! Returning ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Mistress Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: I guess you get what you pay for but this ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for but this sander only lasted about 6 months before biting the dust.
customer_reviews.author: mark g

customer_reviews.title: sanding pads don't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for small sanding projects but I find the sanding pads do not stay in place and eventually work themselves off the pad. I also found that the sander will not work if you put any kind of pressure on it so it doesn't sand very well. I'm sorry I bought this because now I have to find something that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Irla-Marlow

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Random Orbit Sander, 5-Inch (BDERO100)
product_meta.description: Black & Decker BDERO100 5-inch Random Orbit Sander features random orbital action for high removal rate and a high quality finish. This sander offers a hook and loop system for fast and easy paper changes. It also has a dust sealed switch to keep all dust and debris out, to extend tool life.
feature_bullets: Random orbital action for high removal rate and a high quality finish
Hook and loop system for fast and easy paper changes
Dust sealed switch to keep all dust and debris out
Included Components: (1) BDERO100 Sander, (1) Sanding Sheet, (1) Dust Bag

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,365 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
